poem:
Title: Reverberations of a Dream

In the echo of King's voice, steeled dreams fled,
Misused in vain tongues, his hope, weaponized dread.
Six decades past, his sermon, a beacon beaconing,
Now vapors co-opted by rhetoric's reckoning.
Yet, his ideals, firm on Freedom's fragile wing,
Pulsate – far beyond vapid echoes they bring.
